name: EHR
title: EHR
description: The EHR object is the root object and access point of an EHR for a subject of care.

element.short: The EHR object is the root object and access point of an EHR for a subject of care.
element.definition: The EHR object is the root object and access point of an EHR for a subject of care.

constraint.expression: folders.exists() implies for_all f in folders | f.type().is_equal(\"VERSIONED_FOLDER\")

constraint.human: Directory in folders must be present

element.short: The identifier of the logical EHR management system in which this EHR was created.
element.definition: The identifier of the logical EHR management system in which this EHR was created.

element.short: The unique identifier of this EHR.
element.definition:
The unique identifier of this EHR.

NOTE: is is strongly recommended that a UUID always be used for this field.

element.short: List of contributions causing changes to this EHR.
element.definition: List of contributions causing changes to this EHR. Each contribution contains a list of versions, which may include references to any number of `VERSION` instances, i.e. items of type `VERSIONED_COMPOSITION` and `VERSIONED_FOLDER`.

element.short: Reference to `EHR_STATUS` object for this EHR.
element.definition: Reference to `EHR_STATUS` object for this EHR.

element.short: Reference to `EHR_ACCESS` object for this EHR.
element.definition: Reference to `EHR_ACCESS` object for this EHR.

element.short: Master list of all Versioned Composition references in this EHR.
element.definition: Master list of all Versioned Composition references in this EHR.

element.short: Optional directory structure for this EHR.
element.definition: Optional directory structure for this EHR. If present, this is a reference to the first member of `_folders_`.

element.short: Time of creation of the EHR.
element.definition: Time of creation of the EHR.

element.short: Optional additional Folder structures for this EHR.
element.definition: Optional additional Folder structures for this EHR. If set, the `_directory_` attribute refers to the first member.

element.short: Optional list of tags associated with this EHR.
element.definition: Optional list of tags associated with this EHR. Tag `_target_` values can only be within the same EHR.
